abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column examines Supreme Court's eight unsigned rulings from its latest term, most of which illuminate court's narrow view of prisoners' rights.
lead_paragraph: In most of these decisions, one of two things happened: Prisoners challenging their convictions lost or law enforcement officials accused of wrongdoing won.

headline.main: Supreme Court’s Unsigned Rulings Show a Narrow View of Prisoners’ Rights
headline.print_headline: Unsigned Rulings Show a Narrow View of Prisoners’ Rights

snippet: In most of these decisions, one of two things happened: Prisoners challenging their convictions lost or law enforcement officials accused of wrongdoing won.
